title: Packers QB Love has procedure on left thumb
content: Jordan Love had a procedure to repair a ligament injury to his left thumb, but the Packers expect the star QB to be ready for their season opener.

title: Alonso passes Strawberry as Mets' new HR king
content: Pete Alonso hit his 253rd career homer Tuesday night, breaking the franchise record held by Darryl Strawberry for 37 years.

title: Rodgers on new helmet: Looks like a 'spaceship'
content: Aaron Rodgers says he doesn't like the helmet he has been wearing this year, saying it "looks like a damn spaceship."

title: Knee injury ends Vikes WR Moore's season again
content: Vikings receiver/punt returner Rondale Moore suffered a season-ending left knee injury in Saturday's preseason game against the Texans, the team confirmed Tuesday.

title: Richardson apologizes to boyfriend after arrest
content: Sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson addressed her recent domestic violence arrest in a video on social media and issued an apology to her boyfriend, Christian Coleman.

title: Bolts' Harris back running, doing drills at practice
content: Chargers running back Najee Harris, who had been walking laps at practice since Aug. 2, ran and participated in drills for the first time this training camp Tuesday.

title: Gruden eager to find 'truth' in NFL emails case
content: Jon Gruden said Tuesday that he is eager to discover the truth in a Nevada courtroom about whether commissioner Roger Goodell and the NFL leaked emails to the media before he was forced to resign as Raiders head coach in 2021.

title: OU's Mateer denies gambling, was 'inside joke'
content: Oklahoma QB John Mateer, after screenshots of "sports gambling" on his Venmo account surfaced, said it was an "inside joke" and he has "never bet on sports."

title: Ranking the top 50 players in baseball right now: MLB Rank 2025 in-season update
content: We asked ESPN MLB experts to give an updated top-50 ranking, allowing us to take stock of the best performances of the 2025 season so far.

title: MLB Rank update: What we got right -- and very wrong -- on both of this season's lists
content: Who is still too low in our update? Who did we miss in our initial list? Our best -- and worst -- rankings revisited.

title: Barnwell: How Jerry Jones' bungled contract negotiations cost the Cowboys $100 million
content: What are the Cowboys doing?!? The Micah Parsons situation is just the latest in a line of costly mistakes.

title: Lurking concerns for top 10 NBA contenders for the 2025-26 season
content: These 10 NBA franchises have the best chance to capture the NBA title. What hurdles will they have to overcome to raise the Larry O'Brien Trophy?

title: WNBA Power Rankings: The midfield is getting interesting as Aces turn things around
content: With Las Vegas surging and Seattle struggling, the middle of the Power Rankings (and standings) get a shake-up.

title: How every five-star recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: Taylor Swift to join Travis Kelce on 'New Heights,' reveals new album
content: After a teaser post with a Taylor Swift-shaped silhouette fueled rumors, it was confirmed that the pop star will make her first appearance on the Kelce brothers' podcast.

title: Venmo requests and death threats: Heckling in the digital sports betting age
content: Being an athlete in the public eye can have its perks, but also many challenges. The most recent one? Bettors requesting money if they aren't getting the wins.

title: Ranking the 30 best men's soccer club managers in Europe
content: ESPN ranks the top 30 men's managers in the European club game. Who is going to be No. 1? Pep Guardiola, Arne Slot, Luis Enrique?

title: How Flick won his battle with Ter Stegen in Barça coach's riskiest move yet
content: Hansi Flick and Barcelona pushed things to the limit with injured captain Marc-André ter Stegen and won. Time will tell if the gambit was a true success.

title: Bullpen watch: Bednar, Finnegan should see many save chances down the stretch
content: Here are the relief pitchers and closers to keep an eye on in fantasy baseball, including closer situations in New York and Detroit.

title: MLB playoff contender tiers: The locks, teams with work to do and the long shots
content: As hot streaks and cold spells jumble the postseason picture, here's how sure we are that your team will be playing in October.

title: The bloody life of a UFC Octagon
content: Since the UFC's birth in 1993, fighters, coaches and executives have come and gone. The one character that has never changed? The Octagon.

title: Orlovsky ranks the best NFL QBs in seven different traits: Who makes each top-10 list?
content: Which NFL quarterbacks have the strongest arms, greatest accuracy and best rushing ability? Dan Orlovsky stacked the 10 best in seven skill areas.

title: ESPN's preseason All-America team: The best at every position
content: With the 2025 season right around the corner, we break down the top players, from quarterback to kick returner.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City could rival Man United for Donnarumma
content: Chelsea, Man City and Man United are set to go head to head for PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Cristiano to KC? How MLS clubs outside LA, Miami bring big stars to small markets
content: How do MLS teams outside of big-market cities convince big-name players to join them without the lure of Lionel Messi or the star power of Hollywood?

title: 'Beyoncé Bowl' Christmas Ravens-Texans halftime show wins Emmy
content: The performance won for outstanding costumes for variety, nonfiction or reality programming in the 77th annual Emmy Awards.

title: UConn offers stadium suite as part of fantasy football draft hosting package
content: At $75 per person, the Rentschler Field draft experience will get you a catered suite, locker room tour and more.

title: From 'Tank' to Canelo, seven boxers who would benefit from moving up in weight
content: The only thing preventing bigger fights for some of the top boxers in the sport is moving up a weight class (or two).

title: Waiver wire: Leila Lacan, Dominique Malonga among top pickups
content: Leila Lacan is an intriguing backcourt pickup for fantasy managers that need a boost, while Dominique Malonga continues to shine on the Storm.

title: Maharashtra Cabinet approves 15,000 Police posts
content: The Fadnavis-led Cabinet took major decisions such as subsidising air fares, raising margins for ration shop dealers and easing loan norms

title: Aravalli forest reforestation under scrutiny by ABCM trustees, alleging conflict of interest and environmental violations
content: The group members alleged that the action was in violation of several laws protecting forests and environment and an instance of “wrong prioritisation”

title: Release prisoners who have completed sentence: Supreme Court
content: The top court passed the direction while ordering the release of Sukhdev Yadav, alias Pehalwan, in the 2002 Nitish Katara murder case

title: Fatehpur mausoleum vandalism sparks ruckus in U.P. Assembly
content: Opposition alleges BJP leaders incited the crowd, accuses it of shielding culprits and demand accountability; govt. says FIR lodged in the incident, promises legal action

title: “Separate group misusing SAD’s name, will file criminal complaint,” says Akali Dal
content: He also termed the move as illegal, unconstitutional and immoral and said the SAD was consulting legal experts in order to file a formal criminal complaint in this regard

title: Rajiv Pratap Rudy prevails in BJP Vs BJP Constitution Club fight
content: BJP’s Saran MP Rudy has been at the helm of the Constitution Club for nearly a quarter of a century and was largely credited with reviving it from the largely dilapidated state it had fallen into in the years past

title: CM Sukhu urges youth to actively support govt efforts to make Himachal a drug-free State
content: The Chief Minister assured that the government was committed to rehabilitating those trapped in the drug menace

title: CM office, Raj Bhawan submit separate stands to J&K High Court on Gulmarg lease issue
content: The court was hearing the PIL on environmental concerns of Gulmarg and the recent eviction of owners of the Nedou’s Hotel in Gulmarg after 137 years of possession

title: Two Trinamool Congress leaders shot dead in West Bengal in 72 hours
content: So far, 10 Trinamool functionaries have been killed in the State in the last two months, a year before the Assembly elections are to be conducted in West Bengal

title: Tamil Nadu’s history of political silence on murders driven by caste hatred
content: Although leaders such as former Chief Ministers M. Karunanidhi and Jayalalithaa had endeared themselves to all communities, they too were reluctant to stick their necks out and speak out against killing in the name of caste pride

title: MPs from State working for AMNS instead of VSP: CPI(M)
content: The Centre has provided captive mines to all government and private steel plants except the VSP, resulting in the cost of production, said.CPI(M) Visakhapatnam district secretary

title: Finally, a fresh lease of life for Victoria Public Hall in Chennai
content: Within a decade of its completion the Victoria Public Hall had played host to Swami Vivekananda, fresh from his success at the Parliament of Religions at Chicago. In 1915, Mahatma Gandhi spoke here.

title: ED probing into double compensation paid for acquired land: MB Patil
content: Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre clarified that the land had been notified as a State forest in 2006, court orders had upheld it, and alternative land had been allotted as per the Forest Conservation Act.

title: When Jayalalithaa insisted on retaining the casteist term ‘pappathi’ in Tamil Nadu Assembly records
content: Responding to taunts on her Brahmin roots, she, sometime in 1991, declared in the Legislative Assembly, “Naan pappathi thaan (I am a Brahmin woman).”

title: Row over ban on feeding pigeons: Jain monk puts hunger strike on hold, awaits meeting with Fadnavis
content: Religious leader warns of resuming protest with one lakh supporters; threatens civic poll boycott if ban stays

title: ‘Migrant worker sent to Bangladesh booked in neighbouring country for illegal entry’
content: The Trinamool Congress has blamed the Central government for the plight of Amir, who continues to languish in a prison in Bangladesh.

title: On the other side: How Hyderabad’s left-handers adapt to a right-handed society
content: With International Left Handers Day on August 13, the conversation around these subtle disadvantages takes on new relevance.

title: Critical gaps in Indian education sector’s digital defences: CyberPeace report
content: Once a threat actor gains access, they can impersonate faculty or administration, launch AI based phishing campaigns with higher chances of success, produce deepfakes, steal sensitive research data, leak exam papers, and even sell credentials on the darkweb. Also multiple instances of misuse of AI have been observed

title: businessline, GLA University sign campus partnership
content: The collaboration will provide GLA University students with a unique blend of practical knowledge, industry insights and essential resources to excel in their careers

title: Flash flood washes away two women in Tiruvannamalai district
content: Initial inquiry revealed that they were part of an 18-member group from Velappanchavadi village near Thiruverkadu in Chennai, which was visiting the Lord Mallikarjuna temple on the hillock

title: Ramadoss writes to ECI about ‘mischievous’ acts of Anbumani
content: The letter accuses Dr. Anbumani of acting according to his whims and fancies, which is ‘polluting the atmosphere’ and is an attempt to paralyse the party

title: DMK government sleeping for four years, says Palaniswami
content: As part of his Statewide tour, the AIADMK general secretary addresses members of the public in Krishnagiri. Earlier, the former Chief Minister also met and interacted with representatives of farmers’ associations

title: Parliament passes new Income Tax Bill to replace six-decade-old law
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman says it did not impose any new tax rate and only simplified the language, which was required for understanding the complex Income Tax laws

title: Modi should strongly oppose U.S. imposing 50% tariff, says Chief Minister Stalin
content: The Prime Minister’s refusal to answer the Opposition parties’ questions on U.S. President Donald Trump’s claim of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan shows his weakness, he says

title: "Won't Compromise, Will Find New Markets": Shivraj Chouhan Slams US Tariffs
content: Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his determination to protect the interests of farmers despite tariff pressure and said it has been decided that there will be no compromise with the interests of the farming.

title: White House Says Putin Proposed Meeting With Trump
content: US State Department Spokesperson Tammy Bruce said on Tuesday that the upcoming meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump on August 15 in Alaska was "suggested by Putin himself."

title: Delhi Metro Tightens Security Checks Ahead Of 79th Independence Day
content: The Delhi Metro Railway Corporation (DMRC) has intensified security checks ahead of the 79th Independence Day celebrations in the national capital.

title: After Top Court's Stray Dog Order For Delhi, Madras High Court's Big Hint
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court on Tuesday said it would consider directing the Tamil Nadu government to implement in the state the Supreme Court's order on managing street dogs in Delhi.

title: Body Brought For Post-Mortem Dragged At Bihar Hospital, Sparks Outrage
content: The body of a person was caught on camera being dragged inside a state-run hospital in Bihar's West Champaran district, triggering an outrage.

title: Stray Dogs Bite 2 College Students In Bengaluru
content: Two college students here were attacked by stray dogs on Tuesday and have been hospitalised, said a city civic body official.

title: Maharashtra Civic Polls: Raj Thackeray's Party Demands Ballot Paper Voting
content: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) on Tuesday joined the Opposition demand to hold the upcoming civic body polls in the state using ballot papers.

title: "Go To Shelter Or Face Jail": White House Warns Washington DC Homeless People
content: Homeless people in Washington, D.C., could face jail time if they do not comply with President Donald Trump's efforts to crack down on crime and rid the U.S. capital of homeless encampments, the White House said on Tuesday.

title: White House Says Trump-Putin Meeting Is A "Listening Exercise"
content: Friday's Alaska summit between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin "is a listening exercise for the president," the White House said on Tuesday, tempering expectations for a quick Russia-Ukraine ceasefire deal.

title: US, Pakistan Hold Counterterrorism Talks In Islamabad
content: The United States and Pakistan on Tuesday held the latest round of counterterrorism talks in Islamabad, the U.S. State Department said in a statement.

title: Israel In Talks With War-Torn South Sudan To Resettle Palestinians From Gaza
content: Israel is in discussions with South Sudan about the possibility of resettling Palestinians from the Gaza Strip to the war-torn East African country.

title: Muslim Marriages Can Be Dissolved Through Verbal Consent: Court
content: The Gujarat High Court has ruled that a Muslim marriage can be dissolved through 'Mubaraat', a form of divorce wherein couples can end their marriage through verbal mutual consent without a written agreement in place.

title: RG Kar Victim's Father Claims Assault On His Wife 'Pre-Planned'
content: RG Kar rape victim's father wrote to the Kolkata Police Commissioner alleging that the assault on his wife "by police personnel" was "pre-planned".

title: GPR Scanning Helps Identify 20 Spots In Dharali Where People Could Be Trapped
content: Rescuers said they have identified 20 spots at a depth of 2.5-3 metres using Ground Penetrating Radars in the lower areas of Dharali where there is the possibility of people being trapped.

title: No Repairs In The Offing, UP Residents Hold 'Tehravi' For Broken Road
content: Fed up with a year-long delay in repairs, residents held a "memorial service" for their broken road on Tuesday.

title: Top Court To Examine Plea On Convicted Politician Heading Political Party
content: The Supreme Court said it would examine the question whether a politician can be denied the constitutional right to head a political party or association on the basis of conviction and being disqualified to vote.

title: Private Teacher, Driver Found Running Government School In UP
content: Authorities in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district have found a government-run upper primary school being operated by a private tutor and the headmaster's driver in the absence of appointed teaching staff.

title: Not Allowed To Go On Trip With Friends, Odisha Boy Ends Life
content: A schoolboy allegedly ended his life in Odisha's Balasore district by hanging himself after his parents did not allow him to go on a trip with his friends.

title: Mothers Of Gaza Hostages Fear Israeli Offensive Will Endanger Their Sons
content: Mothers of Israeli hostages held in Gaza, including one who appeared emaciated in a recent Hamas video, voiced fears on Tuesday that a planned Israeli offensive could further endanger their sons' lives due to the risk of reprisals.

title: Ram Gopal Varma Appears Before Police Over Morphed Images Of Chief Minister
content: Film director Ram Gopal Varma appeared for questioning before Prakasam district police in connection with a case involving morphed images of Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu and others.

title: Pedestrian woes hamper Bengaluru’s Yellow Line metro station access
content: A reality check by The Hindu at stations like Bommasandra, Hebbagodi, and Electronic City found poor pedestrian infrastructure, long detours to FOBs or underpasses, and even blocked bus bays.

title: Congress leaders start deliberations on V-P polls
content: Closed door meeting attended by Mr. Kharge, Mr. Gandhi, and Mr. Venugopal; an INDIA bloc consensus candidate has little chance of winning, but provides an opportunity for Opposition unity

title: ED summons to lawyers: Supreme Court reserves verdict in suo motu case
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta says if a lawyer had participated in any act beyond his professional duty, amounting to an offence, the “same law which applies to others would apply to lawyers also”

title: Namma Metro ridership crosses 1 million for the first time after Yellow Line launch
content: The newly inaugurated Yellow Line (Line 3) registered 52,215 passengers on its first day of commercial operations

title: Patna tops the chart of convictions for life imprisonment: Bihar DGP
content: In Bihar, a total of 64,098 accused persons were convicted in different criminal cases between January & June this year

title: IAF prioritises induction of long-range missiles after Operation Sindoor success
content: The IAF is also pressing for rapid progress on Project Kusha, an indigenous initiative led by DRDO to develop a long-range air defence missile system

title: Health data at CFTRI, Mysuru, to be analysed using AI and machine learning
content: As part of a national-level CSIR project spanning its laboratories, CFTRI will analyse health data to develop clinically useful personalised risk predictions for various communicable and non-communicable diseases

title: BJP reaches out to Chirag Paswan, asks him to tone down criticism of Nitish government
content: The BJP is trying to prevent any vote split, similar to what happened after the LJP(RV) leader decided to go it alone in the 2020 Assembly election in Bihar

title: ‘124-year-old’ Minta Devi wants poll body to rectify age goof-up
content: The Siwan District Magistrate’s office said Ms. Devi’s husband entered the wrong date of birth while filling up the online application for the voter id card in Siwan

title: Stadium stampede: Opposition demands CBI probe and resignations of CM, DCM and Home Minister
content: BJP demanded the constitution of a Legislature House Committee to evolve appropriate rules to prevent the recurrence of such incidents

title: PixxelSpace India-led consortium to establish India’s first commercial earth observation satellite constellation
content: It is for the first time in the history of the Indian space sector, a private consortium would invest more than ₹1,200 crore over the next five years to launch a constellation of 12 state-of-the-art EO satellites

title: In anticipation of roll revision, Congress begins training of booth-level agents in Assam
content: State unit chief Gaurav Gogoi said that the party has so far registered close to 28,880 BLAs and has started the training process

title: Cherish Tiranga, uphold its timeless ideals of secularism, brotherhood, says J&K CM Omar Abdullah
content: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha took part in a procession at Dal Lake, celebrating the National Flag’s symbolic importance

title: Police did not assault R.G. Kar victim’s mother, says Kolkata Police official
content: During a protest rally at the State Secretariat on August 9, the mother of the R.G. Kar victim was injured on her forehead, for which she blamed the police

title: Aadhaar, voter ID not proof of citizenship, says Bombay High Court rejecting bail plea of alleged Bangladeshi man
content: Babu Abdul Ruf Sardar has been accused of illegally entering India from Bangladesh and obtaining forged Indian identity documents

title: Rahul accuses the Election Commission of not enforcing ‘one man, one vote’ principle
content: Congress leader says there is not just one seat where there is vote theft, but there are a number of seats; this is being done at a national level and systematically, he says

title: India produces 239.30 million tonnes of milk: Centre
content: The total production of cow milk is 1,27,105.15 thousand tonnes, while the production of milk from buffaloes is 1,04,388.29 thousand tonnes

title: Naidu meets young professionals, urges vision-driven development and constituency-based planning
content: Government appoints one post-graduate professional for each Assembly constituency, tasked with working according to constituency-specific vision documents prepared under Swarna Andhra Vision–2047

title: Karnataka High Court criticises conduct of officials of Nirmithi Kendra in denying information under RTI Act
content: Court declares that RTI Act applies to these kendras as they are public authorities on being sponsored and controlled by the Government

title: 18th International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics inaugurated in Mumbai
content: Over 300 high school students from 64 countries have participated in the 10-day Olympiad hosted by the Homi Bhabha Centre for Science Education at the Tata Institute of Fundamental Research

title: The Hindu photojournalists shine in national contest
content: K.R. Deepak, chief photographer, The Hindu, Andhra Pradesh, received first prize for his work titled ‘Lightning’, while K.V.S. Giri, senior special news photographer, The Hindu, Vijayawada, bagged third prize for his work ‘Save The New Generation’ in the ‘Spot News’ category

title: Remove illegal hoardings from roads and  platforms forthwith, Madras High Court directs Tamil Nadu government
content:
The authorities are duty-bound to remove illegal hoardings, arches, banners, and flex-boards. If they fail to do so, they will be guilty of dereliction of duty and negligence, say Justices 
S.M. Subramaniam and G. Arul Murugan

title: No government school has closed down in Kerala in nine years: Minister
content: Union Minister Jayant Chaudhary told Lok Sabha that 205 schools had closed down from 2019-20 to 2023-24. Sivankutty says numbers referred to multi-grade learning centres

title: IISc study highlights how H5N1 influenza poses serious risk to humans
content: Based on their findings, the researchers suggest that enhanced and proactive surveillance measures need to be implemented

title: Election Commission of India willing to correct ‘mistakes’ in Bihar draft roll: Supreme Court
content: While the petitioners reminded the top court of its promise to “step in” if there was “mass exclusion” of voters, ECI’s lawyer cited the draft roll and said it can be corrected by Booth Level Officers

title: Food Safety wing seizes 16,565 litres of spurious coconut oil in raids
content: 9,337  litres of coconut oil not meeting the standards seized from Kollam and 6,530 litres from Alappuzha

title: No coercive action against overage vehicles: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has provided relief to vehicle owners in Delhi by directing a halt to coercive actions against overage vehicles.

title: Aadhaar, PAN, voter ID alone not enough proof of citizenship: Bombay high court
content: The Bombay High Court denied bail to a Thane resident accused of being a Bangladeshi national, emphasizing that possessing documents like Aadhaar and PAN cards doesn't automatically grant Indian citizenship. The court noted the police's allegations of illegal entry and forged documents, along with digital evidence linking him to Bangladesh. The investigation is ongoing.

title: Zelenskyy has been sidelined from the upcoming Russia-US talks - Here's why
content: Donald Trump will meet Vladimir Putin to discuss ending the Ukraine war. The meeting, requested by Putin, excludes Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Trump aims to understand how to achieve peace. Zelenskyy insists no agreement is valid without Ukraine's involvement. European allies support Ukraine's stance. Trump will share the meeting's outcome with Zelenskyy and European leaders. The meeting will be held in Alaska.

title: Ind vs Pak in Asia Cup: 'Humare jawaan ghar wapas nahi aate, aur hum cricket khelne chale jaate hain'
content: Harbhajan Singh has strongly advocated for India to boycott Pakistan matches in the upcoming Asia Cup, echoing the sentiment of 'nation first.' He highlights the sacrifices of soldiers on the border and questions the importance given to Pakistan by the media. Harbhajan was part of the India Champions team that refused to play Pakistan in the WCL.

title: U'khand halts constructions in 'disaster-prone' zones
content: Following the Dharali disaster, Uttarakhand has halted construction in disaster-prone zones. CM Dhami prohibited construction near water sources and ordered identification of vulnerable areas. The directive aims to prevent future construction in sensitive regions and hold officials accountable, prioritizing disaster management and citizen safety in the state.

title: Srinivas' Perplexity, itself valued at $18 bn, makes $34.5 bn all-cash offer to buy Chrome
content: Perplexity, an AI search startup, has made a bold $34.5 billion all-cash offer to acquire Google's Chrome browser, aiming to challenge Google's search dominance. This move comes as Google faces antitrust pressure to divest Chrome. Perplexity pledges significant investment in Chrome's development and open-source nature, while maintaining user choice and continuity.

title: England cricketer blocked from promoting OnlyFans in The Hundred
content: Tymal Mills, the England fast bowler, was prohibited by the ECB from displaying his OnlyFans logo on his bat during The Hundred in August 2025. The decision was influenced by the family-friendly nature of the tournament, as OnlyFans didn't align with it.

title: Airport chaos: Police gun discharges at Sydney Airport
content: A police officer's firearm was discharged at Sydney Airport during an attempted arrest, causing a brief disruption. The incident occurred as a man allegedly tried to seize the officer's weapon, leading to a lockdown of the dining area. Authorities have launched an investigation, confirming no injuries and the resumption of normal airport operations, with no ongoing threat to the public.

title: Dgca issues show cause notice to Indigo for using unapproved simulators for pilot training
content: India's aviation regulator, DGCA, has issued a show-cause notice to IndiGo for allegedly using unapproved simulators to train approximately 1,700 pilots for challenging airfields like Calicut, Leh, and Kathmandu. The DGCA found that critical airfield training was conducted on non-qualified simulators, potentially violating safety regulations.

title: Why neighbours are 'concerned' with Mark Zuckerberg buying houses in Palo Alto
content: Mark Zuckerberg's real estate acquisitions in Palo Alto's Crescent Park, totaling over $110 million, have sparked concerns among neighbors. Extensive renovations, including subterranean spaces, have disrupted the neighborhood's peace. Residents feel the community's spirit has diminished due to the billionaire's presence and perceived disregard for local norms, leading to accusations of exploiting loopholes in zoning laws.

title: Convict given fixed life for 20 yrs entitled to be freed after term: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that convicts serving fixed-term life sentences, like 20 years, are automatically entitled to release upon completion of their term, without needing government remission. Justices Nagarathna and Viswanathan clarified this while ordering the release of Sukhdev Pehalwan in the Nitish Katara case.

title: 9 Himachal Pradesh families vacate homes due to cracks, sinking land
content: Unscientific road widening by the NHAI along the Kiratpur-Manali highway has forced at least nine families to evacuate their homes in five Himachal Pradesh villages. Houses developed cracks and agricultural land began sinking due to the unstable land caused by the highway work. Residents are seeking compensation from NHAI for the damages.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke resigns, says: I’ve decided to leave, to become ...
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke has resigned, prompting a significant restructuring as the platform integrates into Microsoft's CoreAI team under Jay Parikh. Dohmke, who is departing to found a new venture, will remain until the end of 2025 to aid in the transition. GitHub Copilot, boasting over 20 million users, will be a key component of Microsoft's AI strategy.

title: NBA Trade Rumours: Lakers eye $121M Warriors star; LeBron could be key trade asset
content: A shocking mock trade proposes LeBron James and son Bronny to the Golden State Warriors in exchange for Jimmy Butler and a 2028 first-round pick. The Lakers, eyeing a post-LeBron era, might build around Luka Doncic, valuing future assets. While Butler, acquired by the Warriors in February, offers competitiveness, pairing LeBron with Curry could extend Golden State's championship window.

title: ‘War 2’ advance booking: Hrithik & Jr NTR starrer to cross Rs 20 crore mark before Aug 14 release
content: Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's 'War 2' is generating significant buzz ahead of its August 14 release, with advance bookings already exceeding Rs 9 crore. Factoring in blocked seats, the film's gross rises to over Rs 17 crore, signaling strong momentum for the Independence Day weekend.

title: Opposition’s ‘bulk’ objections to SIR not entertained: Election Commission
content: Bihar's Election Commission (EC) defended its handling of electoral roll revisions, stating opposition parties' bulk objections weren't formally processed due to procedural non-compliance. While individual elector claims are being addressed, the INDIA bloc accuses the EC of bias and ignoring irregularities like voter roll deletions.

title: Typo in high court order 'swaps' verdicts for father & son seeking bail
content: A typographical error in a Madhya Pradesh High Court verdict led to a mix-up in the bail orders of a father and son, Halke and Ashok, accused of lynching a shopkeeper. Initially, Halke's lawyer filed a bail bond based on the incorrect information, leading to an order for his release.

title: Joy Taylor opens up for first time about being fired by Fox Sports & ongoing scandalous lawsuit
content: Joy Taylor, recently fired from Fox Sports' 'Speak,' addresses her departure amidst an ongoing lawsuit. While denying any connection between the suit and her termination, Taylor acknowledges the significant changes at FS1. The lawsuit, filed by Noushin Faraji, alleges sexual misconduct involving Taylor, Charlie Dixon, and Emmanuel Acho, with Taylor refuting the claims.

title: This vitamin can cut down heart disease risk by 43%, daily consumption is the key
content: A recent study reveals the importance of vitamin K₁ for heart health. Higher intake of vitamin K₁ is linked to healthier arteries. It may also reduce the risk of cardiovascular death. The study suggests that consuming leafy greens daily is beneficial. It helps in maintaining vascular health. Researchers recommend further studies. They want to confirm these findings.

title: Taylor Swift's New Heights podcast appearance could break Trump’s Joe Rogan record
content: Taylor Swift is set to appear on the New Heights podcast with Travis and Jason Kelce. This appearance has sparked speculation that it could surpass Donald Trump's record for most views. NFL insider Dov Kleiman even bet on Swift's episode outperforming Trump's. This event is seen as a major moment for the podcast and for Swift's influence.

title: Any good law can be misused or abused: Supreme Court; journalists' articles, videos prima facie not sedition, says top court
content: The Supreme Court has shielded 'The Wire' editor Siddharth Varadarajan from arrest under Section 152 of the BNS, cautioning against implicating journalists for news articles. Justices emphasized that a news report doesn't inherently threaten national unity, even while hearing a case against the validity of Section 152.

title: Patrick Mahomes’ mother Randi Mahomes breaks her silence on health rumors after a heartbreaking year
content: Patrick Mahomes' mother, Randi, recently addressed false rumors circulating about her health, including a fabricated report of her death. This occurred after she expressed frustration about not being able to watch a preseason game.

title: Raids at JKLF chief’s home over 1990 murder of Pandit woman
content: The J&K police's SIA raided eight locations in Srinagar, including Yasin Malik's residence, concerning the 1990 murder of Sarla Bhatt, a Kashmiri Pandit hospital employee. This action follows LG Manoj Sinha's commitment to reinvestigate terror killings.

title: 5 'Babbar Khalsa operatives' held; terror plot foiled, claims Punjab DGP
content: Punjab Police dismantled a Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) terror module, arresting two operatives and detaining three juveniles. The module, directed by foreign-based handlers and a Pak-based operative, was planning attacks before Independence Day. Authorities seized a hand grenade, pistol, and ammunition, averting further incidents after a previous liquor store attack.

title: HC panel to review if student who lost eye sight in accident can resume medical studies
content: The Rajasthan High Court has supported a visually impaired MBBS student's plea to continue her studies, emphasizing that vision extends beyond eyesight. The court has instructed medical authorities to form an expert panel to evaluate Ankita Singodia's capabilities and suggest ways to help her finish the course after she lost her vision in an accident.

title: 'He did this to himself': Fans slam Anthony Edwards as Ayesha Howard pushes for $500K payout, public apology
content: Anthony Edwards is embroiled in a contentious legal battle with his ex-girlfriend, Ayesha Howard, following the birth of their daughter in October 2024. Howard is demanding a $500,000 settlement and a public apology, alleging that Edwards wants nothing to do with their child. The situation has sparked outrage among fans, with many criticizing both Edwards' actions and Howard's demands.

title: Stop taking the wrong magnesium: Types of supplements, their benefits, and the BEST of them all
content: Magnesium, vital for various bodily functions, is gaining recognition. Dr. Amy Shah highlights its benefits for brain health, energy, muscle function, and more. While supplements are popular, she emphasizes prioritizing dietary sources like nuts, seeds, and leafy greens. Different magnesium types cater to specific needs, such as sleep, brain function, or heart health.

title: 'Give me old-age pension': '124-yr-old' Minta Devi makes light of poll row
content: Minta Devi from Bihar has criticized opposition MPs for using her name in a protest against the Election Commission's voter roll revision. INDIA bloc leaders wore T-shirts with her name and a claimed age of 124, which she disputes. Devi questions their motives and denies any contact from the administration regarding the alleged discrepancy.

title: No upper hand for US? Why Trump has extended tariff truce with China for another 90 days - explained
content: US President Trump has extended the trade ceasefire with China for 90 days, averting a potential economic confrontation. This pause allows both nations to resolve differences and possibly arrange a meeting between Trump and Xi Jinping. Experts believe Trump's leniency stems from China's control over critical minerals.

title: 1 in 6 NRIs on H-1B visas feel threat of US deportation; many plan of returning to India
content: A growing number of Indian professionals on H-1B visas in the US face unexpected deportation threats post-layoff, even within the 60-day grace period. A recent survey reveals that 16% have received a Notice to Appear (NTA) shortly after job loss, prompting concerns about a potential permanent US ban.

title: 'Trust deficit': SC on Bihar SIR showdown; what happened during the hearing
content: The Supreme Court is reviewing concerns about potential voter disenfranchisement in Bihar's electoral roll revision. The court highlighted a "trust deficit" between the Election Commission and the opposition, addressing arguments about excluded voters and document requirements. The court warned it might intervene if mass exclusion is proven, with the final roll due September 30.

title: 'Totally unacceptable': Irish president condemns attacks on Indians
content: President Michael D. Higgins of Ireland has strongly denounced recent violent attacks against the Indian community, emphasizing that such actions contradict Irish values. He highlighted the deep historical ties between Ireland and India, citing shared experiences and the contributions of the Indian community to Irish society.

title: ED summons Suresh Raina in connection with betting case
content: Suresh Raina has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate for questioning in the 1xBet case, joining a growing list of celebrities under investigation for promoting illegal betting platforms. Actor Rana Daggubati recently appeared before the ED, while several other actors have been booked by Telangana Police for alleged links to online betting promotions.

title: Centre reacts to 'fear mongering' on E20 petrol vehicles; Here's what it said
content: The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas refutes concerns regarding E20 fuel's performance and safety, dismissing claims of significant fuel efficiency loss and insurance issues as unfounded. The ministry emphasizes E20's benefits, including improved acceleration, reduced emissions, and enhanced engine performance. It also highlights the program's economic and environmental advantages.

title: Ayesha Curry Revives Jamaican-born mother’s cooking legacy to guide Stephen Curry’s family
content: Ayesha Curry, influenced by her Jamaican-born mother's generous cooking, shared how those early lessons shaped her life and family values at the Food & Wine Classic. This upbringing instilled in her the importance of shared meals, which now guides her parenting and community work through the Eat.Learn.Play. Foundation, providing food, education, and safe play spaces for children in Oakland.

title: Canada charts an Express Entry reset: A new 'leadership' category - details
content: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) is seeking public input on the future of the Express Entry system, a key pathway to Canadian permanent residency. Proposed changes include a new 'Leadership and Innovation' category prioritizing senior managers and scientists.

title: Out of league! Gill is breaking records — even when he doesn't hold the bat
content: Shubman Gill has etched his name in cricket history by securing his fourth ICC Player of the Month award, a feat unmatched by any other male cricketer. His stellar batting performance in the July 2025 Test series against England, where he also captained the team, earned him this latest recognition.

title: Indus treaty: After nuke threat, Pak's desperate plea to India
content: The request came after Pakistan’s army chief, Asim Munir, issued a nuclear war warning and former foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto made statements calling for action over India’s position on the water-sharing agreement.

title: MS Dhoni didn't expect THIS kind of welcome from fans - WATCH
content: MS Dhoni enjoys a huge fan following. Recently, fans welcomed him with mobile flashlights. Dhoni led Chennai Super Kings (CSK) to five IPL titles and two Champions League T20 titles. He is the only captain to win all three major ICC trophies. Dhoni guided India to victory in the 2007 ICC T20 World Cup.

title: Jordan Love Injury: Packers QB to undergo thumb surgery
content: Green Bay Packers' quarterback Jordan Love will undergo a minor thumb procedure this week, but it's not expected to impact his availability for the regular-season opener. The injury, sustained during a preseason game against the Jets, involves his non-throwing hand. The Packers are confident Love will return to practice next week, with no long-term concerns anticipated.

title: NFL Future Power Rankings: We stacked all 32 teams' long-term expectations
content: in our annual Future Power Rankings, we ranked which teams are primed to be among the league's best over the next three seasons (2025 through 2027) each of the four categories was weighted to create the overall score: quarterback (20%), roster (30%), front office (25%) and coaching (25%). the results are based on how well each team is positioned for the future.

title: Man United's third jersey is remake of infamous 'Cantona kung fu kit'
content: man united have gone back to the glory days of the mid-1990s in search of inspiration for their new retro third kit . the choice of colours alone will instantly ignite nostalgic pangs in all supporters of a certain vintage . when united's Eric Cantona attacked a fan in 1995 the black, yellow and blue palette is immediately reminiscent of the away kit worn by United between 1993 and 1995 .
